Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

No worries. Anything about ARCs is very much on topic.
 
You can not use th=
e tools you mention directly (at least not without adding
some intelligence=
 to skip over response headers and the like in the ARCs).
You'll need to us=
e one of the many ARC access tools to extract individual
pages and then fee=
d them to your tools. There are several tools (some better
then others) ran=
ging from a very low level ARCReader class that comes with
Heritrix and up.=
 Look through old posts here to find more info on them (or
someone will rep=
ost it).
 
It occurs to me however, that you may want to skip the ARCs enti=
rely. A
MirrorWriter was recently added that writes file directly to disk, =
rather
then to ARC files. I'm thinking this might be simpler for you, assum=
ing that
you just want to use your PERL scripts to rip some stuff out, and =
then
discard the downloaded content. Of course then what you REALLY should =
do is
write a Java version of those tools and wrap a processor around it. T=
hen the
crawler would extract the data you want to store and would then sub=
mit it
directly to your DB, rather then write ARCs. :-)
 
Just a thought (o=
r two).
 
- Kris

-----Original Message-----
From: list1dism [mailto:list1d=
ism@...] 
Sent: 23. n=F3vember 2004 09:59
To: archive-crawler@yahoogr=
oups.com
Subject: [archive-crawler] Questions on ARC file format



If I ha=
ppen to be off topic on this one, please say so, and point me
to the right =
place (list) 

First question: Can I utilize the usual HTML parsers availab=
le as Perl
Modules (such as HTML::TreeBuilder and HTML::TokeParser) to work=
 on
the ARC files? If the answer is YES everything is solved and I don't
ne=
ed answers on the other questions. If the answer is NO (which is
probably t=
he case) then...

Second questions: Do you know any open source utility tha=
t can convert
the ARC file into proper HTML? Or even many utilities that ca=
n be used
together to achieve this? Or to I need to parse the document myse=
lf
using regExps to discard everything ARC-specific from it and thus take
a=
s output an almost-proper HTML?

Third Question: Are there any open source =
utilities that can parse ARC
files and extract specific stuff from them, su=
ch as links, titles of
documents etc?

Note: I'm talking about ARCs that ha=
ve only text/html in them. My ARCs
are clean of any binary stuff.

I apolog=
ize in advance if I am off topic. Please forgive.
I thank you any advance f=
or every useful (or not useful) answers or
points to any documentation or u=
tilities on those matters...
